intro: Stenogyne calycosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and woody structure. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in native forests. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
